fix: Use relative API URLs instead of hardcoded Vercel deployment URL

Problem:
- Frontend was hardcoded to point to old Vercel deployment URL
- This caused it to use the old backend with incorrect max_score limits
- Users got "Score too high" errors even after backend fix was deployed

Root Cause:
- js/leaderboard-api.js had hardcoded URL:
  ''https://chessarcade-1ieuxlf7d-claudios-projects.vercel.app/api/scores''
- This URL pointed to an old deployment with the bug
- New deployments created new URLs, but frontend kept using old one

Solution:
- Changed to relative URLs: ''/api/scores''
- Uses localhost:3000 for local development
- Automatically works with ANY Vercel deployment (preview or production)
- No need to update URL on each deployment

Benefits:
- Works seamlessly across all environments
- Preview deployments automatically use correct backend
- Production always uses latest deployed backend
- No more hardcoded URLs to maintain

Testing:
- Local: Uses http://localhost:3000/api/scores
- Production: Uses /api/scores (same domain)
